rename.to: Improve "Ineffective @Order annotation" discovery issue by mentioning meta-annotations

body:
> Could it be possible to add more details in those warnings ?

To avoid confusion, we could point out that the `@Order` annotation may be present as a meta-annotation, and I've updated the title of this issue to reflect that.

Here is a demo: [demo.tar.gz](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21017757/demo.tar.gz)

Simply run `./mvnw verify` with a JDK 17 in the path and you'll see the warning:

```
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------
[INFO]  T E S T S
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------
2025-07-02T12:18:08.593694600Z main WARN Ignoring call to `j.u.l.Logger.setLevel(WARNING)`, since the Log4j API does not provide methods to modify the underlying implementation.
To modify the configuration using JUL, use an `AbstractLoggerAdapter` appropriate for your logging implementation.
See https://logging.apache.org/log4j/3.x/log4j-jul.html#log4j.jul.loggerAdapter for more information.
14:18:08.739 [main] INFO  org.junit.platform.launcher.core.DiscoveryIssueNotifier - TestEngine with ID 'junit-jupiter' encountered a non-critical issue during test discovery:

(1) [INFO] Ineffective @Order annotation on class 'com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest'. It will not be applied because ClassOrderer.OrderAnnotation is not in use.
    Source: ClassSource [className = 'com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest', filePosition = null]
            at com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest.<no-method>(SourceFile:0)
[INFO] Running com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest
14:18:08.816 [main] WARN  com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest - TEST
[INFO] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.036 s -- in com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest
14:18:08.835 [main] INFO  org.junit.platform.launcher.core.DiscoveryIssueNotifier - TestEngine with ID 'junit-jupiter' encountered a non-critical issue during test discovery:

(1) [INFO] Ineffective @Order annotation on class 'com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest'. It will not be applied because ClassOrderer.OrderAnnotation is not in use.
    Source: ClassSource [className = 'com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest', filePosition = null]
            at com.example.demo.DemoApplicationTest.<no-method>(SourceFile:0)
[INFO]
```

And I think most people don't see the issue in other IDE or in Maven because JUnit seems to use `java.util.logging`: the default configuration is probably to log nothing, but somehow on my Eclipse, it is configured to log something and then I see the warning in red (stderr) in the console.

> > Could it be possible to add more details in those warnings ?
> 
> To avoid confusion, we could point out that the `@Order` annotation may be present as a meta-annotation, and I've updated the title of this issue to reflect that.

That would a be a start.

issue.title: Improve message of discovery issues for ineffective `@Order` annotations

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Resolves #4713.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit-framework/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://docs.junit.org/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
